formattedAddress: 111 Worth St, New York, NY 10013, USA
adrFormatAddress: 111 Worth St, New York, NY 10013, USA

originalText.text: The two ladies who ring you up in front are very rude. Everytime I come into the store they always stare at me with a nasty look on their faces as if they are scowling at me, maybe I am too dark to be in their store? My last straw was when I picked up a lunch order, I stand in line like everyone else, I get ready to pay, and because I’m reaching into my bag to take my money, the lady who’s ringing ME up, cancels my order and decides to ring up the white man behind me, as if I was going to take an hour to pull out my wallet. This is a POORLY RUN & HIGHLY DISRESPECTFUL establishment. As a black woman I felt targeted and attacked in this store and after that day, I never went back to this place to eat. The food isn’t good either, no bathrooms and it’s not properly cleaned. The people who work here need to learn about racial discrimination laws and customer service. I will be reporting to the better business bureau, and I will never spend money and this racist establishment ever again. It’s a shocker that this happened to me in July of 2023. Very appalling.

originalText.text: This place makes some of the best sandwiches in New York City and the City Hall area. One of my favorites is the Chicken Supremo (just note that it's made with bacon so if you don't eat bacon just ask for 'Chicken Supremo no bacon'. For the volume of people that walk in they get you in and out relatively quick

originalText.text: We were finding a place to eat while walking around and I saw this place and we went in. I regret going to this place as there is no line to order, the chefs will attend you when they feel like it. The seating area is disgusting and I had a hard time enjoying my food. We paid $54 for 2 Philly sandwiches and a buffet order! It surely didn’t taste like the price we paid. Please save yourself the disappointment of eating here and look into different places to eat. Not to mention the windows aren’t clean and there’s trash all over the floor! The cashier women are incredibly rude as well. I didn’t truly understand the importance of having clean windows when I worked at Frank Pepe’s but now I can understand why. Eat somewhere else.

originalText.text: Food is good but overpriced, no bathroom at all, cashier was rude and looked annoyed, not enough sitting spots or tables.
